Tanks

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tanks.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends java.lang.Object
    The Projectile class represents a projectile fired by a tank. It calculates the trajectory of the projectile based on initial velocity, wind speed, and gravity.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projectile(processing.core.PApplet app, int x, int y, float initialVelocity, float vx, float vy, java.lang.String tankSig)
      Constructs a new Projectile object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Gets the x-coordinate of the projectile.

      Gets the y-coordinate of the projectile.

      Simulates the trajectory of the projectile.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(processing.core.PApplet app,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  float initialVelocity,
                  float vx,
                  float vy,
                  java.lang.String tankSig)
        Constructs a new Projectile object.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet object for drawing.
        x - The initial x-coordinate of the projectile.
        y - The initial y-coordinate of the projectile.
        initialVelocity - The initial velocity of the projectile.
        vx - The horizontal velocity of the projectile.
        vy - The vertical velocity of the projectile.
        tankSig - The signature of the tank firing the projectile, tanks character.

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        Simulates the trajectory of the projectile. It updates the position of the projectile and checks for collisions with tanks and terrain.

      • isCollided

        public boolean isCollided()
        Returns:
        True if the projectile has collided, otherwise False.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Gets the x-coordinate of the projectile.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of the projectile.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Gets the y-coordinate of the projectile.
        Returns:
        The y-coordinate of the projectile.
